title: Beyond Curry: Potato, Egg and Chutney Pattice Recipe
full_text:
Beyond Curry: Potato, Egg and Chutney Pattice Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
15 mins
Active
25 mins
Total
25 mins
Makes
12 Pattices
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
4
medium
potatoes
, boiled, mashed, and cooled
One
small bunch
coriander leaves
1 1/2
tablespoons
grated coconut
1
teaspoon
cumin seeds
2-3
green chiles
, or to taste
6
medium cloves
garlic
Kosher salt
1/2
teaspoon
sugar
3
hard-boiled eggs
, cut lengthwise into quarters
4
tablespoons
vegetable oil
1
egg
, beaten
Directions
Use a tablepoon measure to make 12 balls of mashed potato. Knead each ball in your hands until smooth and form into a hollow cup.
Grind together coriander, grated coconut, cumin seeds, green chiles, garlic, salt, and sugar in a food processor or mortar and pestle to make a paste. Spread a teaspoon of the paste evenly into each hollow in the potatoes. (You should have some chutney left over.) Put an egg quarter in the chutney filled hollow. Close tightly with more mashed potato until everything is sealed carefully inside.
Heat the oil in a large nonstick or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Dip each pattice in the beaten egg and gently place in oil. Fry, turning frequently, until golden on each side. Remove, drain on a paper towel or clean kitchen towel-lined plate, and serve hot with remaining chutney.
Potatoes
Indian
Boiled Eggs
Sides
